meanings.sent1: The baby was grizzling softly in her crib.
meanings.sent2: She was grizzling because she couldn't find her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The puppy started grizzling when it saw its reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: As the sad movie played, tears grizzling down her cheeks.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the trees sway, their leaves grizzling in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To have a mixture of gray and white hair
meanings.sent1: The old cat was grizzling around its muzzle.
meanings.sent2: His hair was slowly grizzling with age.
meanings.sent3: The dog's fur started grizzling as it grew older.
meanings.sent4: The mountains looked majestic with their grizzling peaks.
meanings.sent5: The winter snow was grizzling the landscape with a soft touch of gray.

meanings.definition: To complain or grumble in a low voice
meanings.sent1: She was grizzling about having to do her chores.
meanings.sent2: The old man would grizzle about the weather every day.
meanings.sent3: The cat would grizzle when it didn't get its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The engine grizzled as it struggled to start in the cold.
meanings.sent5: The students would grizzle quietly when given extra homework.
